Name: Seleucids
History: The Macedonian-Greek dynasty that ruled most of Alexander's former empire.

Factions.Name: Seleucids
Factions.Description: The Macedonian-Greek dynasty that ruled the Eastern part of Alexander's former empire.

Technologies.Name: Cavalry Reform
Technologies.History: Seleucid and indeed Successor warfare evolved over the course of the 3rd and 2nd centuries. Contact with Eastern upstarts such as the Parthians and constant revolts of peripheral satrapies such as Bactria caused the Seleucids to reform their military and change their tactics, specifically in the cavalry arm.

Technologies.Name: Infantry Reform
Technologies.History: Seleucid and indeed Successor warfare evolved over the course of the 3rd and 2nd centuries. War with the Romans from the West and invasions from the Galatians forced the Seleucids to reform some of their infantry regiments to be more flexible.

Technologies.Name: Cleruchy
Technologies.History: The Seleucids attracted a large number of Greek, Macedonian, Thracian and other settlers, who were granted land around newly founded cities in return for military service.
Technologies.Description: 25% faster batch training for the Military Barracks.

Technologies.Name: Nisean War Horses
Technologies.History: The beautiful and powerful breed of Nisean horses increases health for Seleucid cavalry.

Heroes.Name: Seleukos A' Nikator
Heroes.History: Always lying in wait for the neighboring nations, strong in arms and persuasive in council, he (Seleucus) acquired Mesopotamia, Armenia, 'Seleucid' Cappadocia, Persis, Parthia, Bactria, Arabia, Tapouria, Sogdia, Arachosia, Hyrcania, and other adjacent peoples that had been subdued by Alexander, as far as the river Indus, so that the boundaries of his empire were the most extensive in Asia after that of Alexander. The whole region from Phrygia to the Indus was subject to Seleucus. â€” Appian, 'The Syrian Wars'.

Heroes.Name: Antiokhos G' Megas
Heroes.History: Antiochus inherited a troubled kingdom upon the beginning of his reign. From the verge of collapse he managed to weld back together the empire Seleukus I so hard to found. The rebellious eastern satraps of Bactria and Parthia were brought to heel , temporarily securing his eastern borders. He then turned his attention to mother Greece, attempting to fulfill the dreams of his fathers by invading Greece under the pretext of liberation. The Achaean League and the Kingdom of Pergamon banded together with the Romans to defeat him at the Battle of Magnesia, forever burying the dream of reuniting Alexander's empire.

Heroes.Name: Antiokhos D' Epiphanes
Heroes.History: Antiochus IV Epiphanes was a son of Antiochus III the Great and brother of Seleucus IV Philopator. Originally named Mithridates, he assumed the name Antiochus either upon his accession to the throne or after the death of his elder brother Antiochus. Notable events during his reign include the near-conquest of Egypt (twice), which was halted by the threat of Roman intervention, and the beginning of the Jewish revolt of the Maccabees. He died of sudden illness while fighting off a Parthian invasion from the East.

CivBonuses.Name: Foreign Dynasty
CivBonuses.History: The Seleucids and Ptolemies chose military settlers as the core of their armies, as those troops were generally more loyal and less risky to train than conquered people.
CivBonuses.Description: Two types of Barracks. Military barracks train Hellenistic units which are generally more powerful and have more upgrades, while Levy Barracks train Subject Levies which are weaker, have less upgrades but are easier to mass produce.

CivBonuses.Name: Mesopotamia
CivBonuses.History: For almost two hundred years the Seleucids controlled the fertile region between the rivers Tigres and Ephrates.
CivBonuses.Description: Farms -25% wood cost and construction time.

CivBonuses.Name: Elite Forces
CivBonuses.History: Having to protect a huge realm surrounded by enemies, the Seleucids employed a well-trained standing force including various elite regiments.
CivBonuses.Description: Increased number of Champion units available.

TeamBonuses.Name: Great City Founders
TeamBonuses.History: Even more so than other Successors, the Seleucids founded a huge number of cities, more often than not named Antiochia or Seleucia.
TeamBonuses.Description: Civic Centers are 20% cheaper (currently not shared).

Structures.Name: Library
Structures.History: Alexander the Great founded libraries all over his new empire. These became a center of learning for an entirely new synthesized culture: the Hellenistic culture.
Structures.Description: Maximum of 1 built. Includes special technologies.
